subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Chris Moon/Frank's Box on YouTube
author: Lisby
full_text:
Perhaps I should have been more specific.

Ominous--in reference to the people speaking through the box not  
being our loved ones who are "somewhere else."


On Dec 31, 2007, at 7:38 PM, Ken wrote:

>
> Ominous?  It depends on which side of the fence your on?  I have  
> been in a position
> of asking for Angels / Gods protection after sensing what was  
> perceived as evil.
> Good and evil / Light & darkness can not exist in the same space.  
> You can't have
> one without the other. Negativity will always be overpowered by  
> Good & darkness
> will always be illuminated by the light.  Negative entities will  
> try to lie and / or mislead?
> You can't always know who your dealing with, but that's part of the  
> investigating process,
> isn't it?  Asking & Trying to determine who your dealing with?
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Lisby
> To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
> Sent: Monday, December 31, 2007 3:53 PM
> Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Chris Moon/Frank's Box on YouTube
>
> That  sounds quite ominous, Zack. Not sure I like the sound of it.  
> What is your theory?
>
>
> Ann
>
> On Dec 31, 2007, at 2:21 PM, Zack Widup wrote:
>
>>
>> We actually don't know who we're communicating with using the  
>> boxes. I
>> suspect it isn't what we traditionally call a "ghost".
>>
>> I also suspect that people are not hearing their loved ones. The  
>> loved
>> oneshave probably been elsewhere for some time ...
>>
>> Zack
>>
>> On Mon, 31 Dec 2007, immortallic2 wrote:
>>
>> > I personally have seen Chris use his box in public forum four  
>> times.
>> > I have heard the box give audible yes and no type answers to  
>> peoples
>> > questions. I do feel though that the ones that get emotionally  
>> moved
>> > the most are the ones wanting with all their heart to hear from a
>> > loved one. When these people get an answer that may or may not be
>> > heard by all, they feel that it is indeed from a loved one and it
>> > hits them in the heart as if it was real. I would love to hear a
>> > recorded session from start to finish as an investigator. After all
>> > this research is for all not just "30".... :-)
>> >
>>
>
>
>
>
